intro: Fimbristylis diphylla var. laxa, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and Australia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and typically grows in wet or marshy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers that are often green or brown in color. It is characterized by its two distinct leaf forms, with the lower leaves being longer and narrower than the upper ones. This variety is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
